div.head: MERELY VALID, JUST AND UNIVERSAL.
div.p: Some of our esteemed contemporaries object to Secretary Bryan’s conversion to suffrage on the ground that the reasons he gives for his conversion are not new.
The same criticism might be made of the Ten Commandments.

div.head: WHY WOMEN WANT POLICEWOMEN.
div.p: The Under Secretary for the Home Office in England advances a curious reason against the appointment of policewomen.

He told delegations from twenty-four organizations who waited on him that he believed that in cases of assaults on women and children the victims' stories had better be told to womén, but, he said: "There is a prejudice against women. There might be more against women constables.”

div.head: THOUGHT THEIR PLACE WAS THE HOME.
div.p: A mother has kidnapped her children from the Albany Orphan Asylum and is holding them in a house with barricaded doors.
A judge committed them to the asylum after a series of freight car robberies, in which, it is said they had a part.
The ages of these criminals range from twelve to fourteen years.

div.head: WOMEN DON’T SEEM TO UNDERSTAND POLITICS.
div.p: Mrs. Grish, head of Jersey City’s Poor Department, is not giving satisfaction to certain elements in the community. She is reported to have made a reduction of 50 per cent in the expenses of her department
And to have administered relief without regard to politics.

div.head: WHY WE OPPOSE SHIRTWAISTS FOR MEN.
div.p: 1—Because the great majority of men do not want shirtwaists. The present outery is raised by a small minority of disappointed men who have failed to charm women in the costume of a gentleman and so favor any change.

2—Because shirtwaists would add a new burden to men's already overburdened lives. They would have to give time and attention not only to the fit and pattern of their shirts, but to the development of their figures.
3—Because shirtwaists would distract men from their business duties. They must not listen to false friends who tell them they could select their waists in a few minutes. Do women?
4—Because it would lessen the respect in which women hold men.What woman could look up to a shirtwaist man as she now does to one in a graceful swallow-tail?

5—Because identity of costume would tend to wipe out all differentiation between the sexes. Any student knows that this will do away with the home, destroy the sanctity of the marriage tie and so eventually undermine the foundations of this great Republic.

div.head: AND AS A MATTER OF FACT IT DOESN'T.
div.p: Three hundred or more convicts were engaged in a riot in Trenton State's Prison on July 13.
So far we have not heard any one suggest that this proves that no man is fit to be Commissioner of Correction.

div.head: EXPERIMENTAL PSYCHOLOGY.
div.p: Whenever we ask a woman over fifty if girls were more attractive twenty-five years ago than they are now, she says: "Oh, dear, yes!" But when we put the same question to a girl under twenty, she answers, "Of course not!"
